metadata.title: CVE-2021-40438 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A crafted request uri-path can cause mod_proxy to forward the request to anorigin server choosen by the remote user. This issue affects Apache HTTPServer 2.4.48 and earlier.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40438` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.6
apache2-bin - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.6
apache2-data - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.6
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.6
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.6
apache2-utils - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.6
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.6
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.41-4ubuntu3.6').
